experiment_design_description: equimolar mix of pool members for Illumina HiSeq sequencing
library_construction_protocol: Maize roots-associated soil DNA was extracted using MoBio PowerSoil -htp 96 well soil DNA isolation kits. Partial bacterial 16S rRNA genes from maize rhizosphere microbiota were amplified by using an Illumina primer pair. The Illumina primer pair contained a composite forward 515F primer with an Illumina-specific linker sequence, and a reverse 806R primer with unique 12-bp Golay indexes to multiplex the samples, and an Illumina-specific linker sequence. The PCR conditions were as described previously (Caporaso et al., 2011). Each DNA sample was amplified in triplets, and the triplets were pooled on the Eppendorf EpMotion automated pipetting system. The quality of amplification was checked using agarose gel electrophoreses. The pooled amplicons were purified with MagBind E-Z Pure beads, and were quantitated using Quant-iT PicoGreen dsDNA kits. The concentrations of samples were normalized, and the samples were mixed to make an equimolar library.

The Illumina primer pair contained a composite forward 515F primer with an Illumina-specific linker sequence, and a reverse 806R primer with unique 12-bp Golay indexes to multiplex the samples, and an Illumina-specific linker sequence. The PCR conditions were as described previously (Caporaso et al., 2011). Each DNA sample was amplified in triplets, and the triplets were pooled on the Eppendorf EpMotion automated pipetting system. The quality of amplification was checked using agarose gel electrophoreses. The pooled amplicons were purified with MagBind E-Z Pure beads, and were quantitated using Quant-iT PicoGreen dsDNA kits. The concentrations of samples were normalized, and the samples were mixed to make an equimolar library.

The PCR conditions were as described previously (Caporaso et al., 2011). Each DNA sample was amplified in triplets, and the triplets were pooled on the Eppendorf EpMotion automated pipetting system. The quality of amplification was checked using agarose gel electrophoreses. The pooled amplicons were purified with MagBind E-Z Pure beads, and were quantitated using Quant-iT PicoGreen dsDNA kits. The concentrations of samples were normalized, and the samples were mixed to make an equimolar library.

Partial bacterial 16S rRNA genes from maize rhizosphere microbiota were amplified by using an Illumina primer pair. The Illumina primer pair contained a composite forward 515F primer with an Illumina-specific linker sequence, and a reverse 806R primer with unique 12-bp Golay indexes to multiplex the samples, and an Illumina-specific linker sequence. The PCR conditions were as described previously (Caporaso et al., 2011). Each DNA sample was amplified in triplets, and the triplets were pooled on the Eppendorf EpMotion automated pipetting system. The quality of amplification was checked using agarose gel electrophoreses. The pooled amplicons were purified with MagBind E-Z Pure beads, and were quantitated using Quant-iT PicoGreen dsDNA kits. The concentrations of samples were normalized, and the samples were mixed to make an equimolar library.

The Illumina primer pair contained a composite forward 515F primer with an Illumina-specific linker sequence, and a reverse 806R primer with unique 12-bp Golay indexes to multiplex the samples, and an Illumina-specific linker sequence. The PCR conditions were as described previously (Caporaso et al., 2011). Each DNA sample was amplified in triplets, and the triplets were pooled on the Eppendorf EpMotion automated pipetting system. The quality of amplification was checked using agarose gel electrophoreses. The pooled amplicons were purified with MagBind E-Z Pure beads, and were quantitated using Quant-iT PicoGreen dsDNA kits. The concentrations of samples were normalized, and the samples were mixed to make an equimolar library.

The PCR conditions were as described previously (Caporaso et al., 2011). Each DNA sample was amplified in triplets, and the triplets were pooled on the Eppendorf EpMotion automated pipetting system. The quality of amplification was checked using agarose gel electrophoreses. The pooled amplicons were purified with MagBind E-Z Pure beads, and were quantitated using Quant-iT PicoGreen dsDNA kits. The concentrations of samples were normalized, and the samples were mixed to make an equimolar library.
